content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) that smelts iron ore into iron plates.
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) that stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) that extracts iron ore (warning: out of fuel).
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) that transfers ore from the extraction point.
– Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) that delivers extracted ore.
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) that stores delivered ore.
– Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) channeling ore to a remote branch.
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) that moves ore along the intermediate belt.
– Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) receiving ore for further routing.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) that smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) processing science packs.
– Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) drawing water.
– Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) supplying steam.
– Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) generating electricity.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) configured for pipe production (warnings: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate).
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) storing crafted pipes.
– Electricity network via small electric poles interlinking facility components.

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97180) at position (8.5, 5.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 8.5, 5.5)
– Pipe (position: 8.5, 6.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97181) at position (10.5, 4.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 10.5, 4.5)
– Pipe (position: 11.5, 4.5)
– Pipe (position: 12.5, 4.5) and additional pipes (e.g., at positions (7.5, 14.5), (7.5, 15.5), (8.5, 14.5))

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97184) at position (-9.5, 9.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: -9.5, 9.5)
– Pipe (position: -8.5, 9.5)
– Pipe (position: -8.5, 8.5) … continuing through several segments ending with pipes at (‑1.5, 24.5), (‑0.5, 24.5) and (0.5, 24.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97187) at position (2.5, 9.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 2.5, 9.5)
– Pipe (position: 3.5, 9.5)
– Pipe (position: 3.5, 10.5)
– Pipe (position: 3.5, 11.5)
– Pipe (position: 2.5, 10.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97188) at position (10.5, 9.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 10.5, 9.5)
– Pipe (position: 10.5, 8.5)
– Pipe (position: 9.5, 15.5) … with further segments including pipes at (9.5, 16.5), (6.5, 18.5) and (7.5, 18.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97193) at position (1.5, 11.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 1.5, 11.5)
– Pipe (position: 1.5, 13.5)
– Pipe (position: 0.5, 13.5) … along with additional segments (e.g., (5.5, 14.5), (4.5, 14.5), (4.5, 15.5))

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97204) at position (-1.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: -1.5, 17.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97207) at position (6.5, 16.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: 6.5, 16.5)

### Fluid Pipeline Group (fluid_system==97208) at position (-1.5, 21.5)
Consists of:
– Pipe (position: -1.5, 21.5)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Candidate PipeGroup Not Found Errors
  - Repeated connection attempts using candidate PipeGroups with fluid_system identifiers [93796, 93938, 94080, 94222, 94506, 94648, 94790, 94932, 95074, 95216, 95358, 95500, 95642, 95784, 95926, 96068, 96210, 96352, 96494, 96636, 96778, 96920, 97062] near (-1.5, 17.5) have failed. Verify that these PipeGroups exist and are correctly positioned before initiating connection routines.

• Manual Pipe Placement Issues
  - Ensure the target tile is unoccupied and that placement conditions are met before attempting manual pipe placement.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues
  - Provide a stable power supply and ensure the required resources (e.g., iron-plate) are available for the Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5).

• Power Generation and Fluid Supply Connection Issues
  - Verify proper fluid inputs and network connectivity for components of the Lab Power Integration System (Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and Steam Engine at (5.5, 5.5)).

• Burner Mining Drill Fuel Shortage
  - Supply sufficient fuel to the Burner Mining Drill in the Iron Ore Mining Setup.

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections
  - Confirm that pipes and connection components are appropriately allocated and accessible despite overall inventory sufficiency.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at a given position; returns the entity if found or raises an exception.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct its alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (5.5, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
